intro: Corydalis schanginii, commonly known as the Chinese larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender stems and trifoliate leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
